member.name: T:System.Buffers.Text.Base64Url
member.summary: Converts between binary data and URL-safe ASCII encoded text that's represented in Base64Url characters.

member.name: M:System.Buffers.Text.Base64Url.DecodeFromChars(System.ReadOnlySpan{System.Char},System.Span{System.Byte},System.Int32@,System.Int32@,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Decodes the span of unicode ASCII chars represented as Base64Url into binary data.
member.param: The input span which contains unicode ASCII chars in Base64Url that needs to be decoded.
The output span which contains the result of the operation, i.e. the decoded binary data.

When this method returns, contains the number of input chars consumed during the operation. This can be used to slice the input for subsequent calls, if necessary. This parameter is treated as uninitialized.

When this method returns, contains the number of bytes written into the output span. This can be used to slice the output for subsequent calls, if necessary. This parameter is treated as uninitialized.

param.name: isFinalBlock
param.para: when the input span contains the entirety of data to encode; when more data may follow,
such as when calling in a loop. Calls with should be followed up with another call where this parameter is call. The default is .

member.returns: One of the enumeration values that indicates the success or failure of the operation.

member.name: M:System.Buffers.Text.Base64Url.DecodeFromChars(System.ReadOnlySpan{System.Char},System.Span{System.Byte})
member.summary: Decodes the span of unicode ASCII chars represented as Base64Url into binary data.
member.param: The input span which contains ASCII chars in Base64Url that needs to be decoded.
The output span which contains the result of the operation, i.e. the decoded binary data.
member.exception: The buffer in is too small to hold the encoded output.

exception.para: more than two padding characters, or a non white space character among the padding characters.

member.returns: The number of bytes written into the output span. This can be used to slice the output for subsequent calls, if necessary.

member.name: M:System.Buffers.Text.Base64Url.DecodeFromChars(System.ReadOnlySpan{System.Char})
member.summary: Decodes the span of unicode ASCII chars represented as Base64Url into binary data.
member.param: The input span which contains ASCII chars in Base64Url that needs to be decoded.

exception.para: more than two padding characters, or a non white space character among the padding characters.

member.returns: A byte array which contains the result of the decoding operation.

member.name: M:System.Buffers.Text.Base64Url.DecodeFromUtf8(System.ReadOnlySpan{System.Byte},System.Span{System.Byte},System.Int32@,System.Int32@,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Decodes the span of UTF-8 encoded text represented as Base64Url into binary data.
member.param: The input span which contains UTF-8 encoded text in Base64Url that needs to be decoded.
The output span which contains the result of the operation, i.e. the decoded binary data.

When this method returns, contains the number of input bytes consumed during the operation. This can be used to slice the input for subsequent calls, if necessary. This parameter is treated as uninitialized.

When this method returns, contains the number of bytes written into the output span. This can be used to slice the output for subsequent calls, if necessary. This parameter is treated as uninitialized.

param.name: isFinalBlock
param.para: when the input span contains the entirety of data to encode; when more data may follow,
such as when calling in a loop. Calls with should be followed up with another call where this parameter is call. The default is .

member.returns: One of the enumeration values that indicates the success or failure of the operation.

member.name: M:System.Buffers.Text.Base64Url.DecodeFromUtf8(System.ReadOnlySpan{System.Byte},System.Span{System.Byte})
member.summary: Decodes the span of UTF-8 encoded text represented as Base64Url into binary data.
member.param: The input span which contains UTF-8 encoded text in Base64Url that needs to be decoded.
The output span which contains the result of the operation, i.e. the decoded binary data.
member.exception: The buffer in is too small to hold the encoded output.

exception.para: more than two padding characters, or a non white space character among the padding characters.

member.returns: The number of bytes written into . This can be used to slice the output for subsequent calls, if necessary.

member.name: M:System.Buffers.Text.Base64Url.DecodeFromUtf8(System.ReadOnlySpan{System.Byte})
member.summary: Decodes the span of UTF-8 encoded text represented as Base64Url into binary data.
member.param: The input span which contains UTF-8 encoded text in Base64Url that needs to be decoded.

exception.para: more than two padding characters, or a non white space character among the padding characters.

member.returns: >A byte array which contains the result of the decoding operation.

member.name: M:System.Buffers.Text.Base64Url.DecodeFromUtf8InPlace(System.Span{System.Byte})

summary.para: Decodes the span of UTF-8 encoded text in Base64Url into binary data, in-place.
The decoded binary output is smaller than the text data contained in the input (the operation deflates the data).

member.param: The input span which contains the base 64 text data that needs to be decoded.

exception.para: more than two padding characters, or a non white space character among the padding characters.

member.returns: The number of bytes written into . This can be used to slice the output for subsequent calls, if necessary.

member.name: M:System.Buffers.Text.Base64Url.EncodeToChars(System.ReadOnlySpan{System.Byte},System.Span{System.Char},System.Int32@,System.Int32@,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Encodes the span of binary data into unicode ASCII chars represented as Base64Url.
member.param: The input span which contains binary data that needs to be encoded.
The output span which contains the result of the operation, i.e. the ASCII chars in Base64Url.

>When this method returns, contains the number of input bytes consumed during the operation. This can be used to slice the input for subsequent calls, if necessary. This parameter is treated as uninitialized.

>When this method returns, contains the number of chars written into the output span. This can be used to slice the output for subsequent calls, if necessary. This parameter is treated as uninitialized.

param.name: isFinalBlock
param.para: when the input span contains the entirety of data to encode; when more data may follow,
such as when calling in a loop, subsequent calls with should end with call. The default is .

member.returns: One of the enumeration values that indicates the success or failure of the operation.

member.name: M:System.Buffers.Text.Base64Url.EncodeToChars(System.ReadOnlySpan{System.Byte},System.Span{System.Char})
member.summary: Encodes the span of binary data into Unicode ASCII chars represented as Base64Url.
member.param: The input span which contains binary data that needs to be encoded.
The output span which contains the result of the operation, i.e. the ASCII chars in Base64Url.
member.exception: The buffer in is too small to hold the encoded output.
member.returns: The number of bytes written into the destination span. This can be used to slice the output for subsequent calls, if necessary.

member.name: M:System.Buffers.Text.Base64Url.EncodeToChars(System.ReadOnlySpan{System.Byte})
member.summary: Encodes the span of binary data into unicode ASCII chars represented as Base64Url.
member.param: The input span which contains binary data that needs to be encoded.
member.returns: A char array which contains the result of the operation, i.e. the ASCII chars in Base64Url.

member.name: M:System.Buffers.Text.Base64Url.EncodeToString(System.ReadOnlySpan{System.Byte})
member.summary: Encodes the span of binary data into Unicode string represented as Base64Url ASCII chars.
member.param: The input span that contains binary data that needs to be encoded.
member.returns: A string that contains the result of the operation, i.e. the ASCII string in Base64Url.

When this method returns, contains the number of input bytes consumed during the operation. This can be used to slice the input for subsequent calls, if necessary. This parameter is treated as uninitialized.

When this method returns, contains the number of bytes written into the output span. This can be used to slice the output for subsequent calls, if necessary. This parameter is treated as uninitialized.

param.name: isFinalBlock
param.para: when the input span contains the entirety of data to encode; when more data may follow,
such as when calling in a loop, subsequent calls with should end with call. The default is .

member.returns: One of the enumeration values that indicates the success or failure of the operation.

member.name: M:System.Buffers.Text.Base64Url.EncodeToUtf8(System.ReadOnlySpan{System.Byte},System.Span{System.Byte})

member.exception: The buffer in is too small to hold the encoded output.
member.returns: The number of bytes written into the destination span. This can be used to slice the output for subsequent calls, if necessary.

member.name: M:System.Buffers.Text.Base64Url.EncodeToUtf8(System.ReadOnlySpan{System.Byte})
member.summary: Encodes the span of binary data into UTF-8 encoded text represented as Base64Url.

member.name: M:System.Buffers.Text.Base64Url.GetEncodedLength(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns the length (in bytes) of the result if you were to encode binary data within a byte span of size .
member.param: The size of the input span.
member.exception: is less than 0 or greater than 1610612733.
member.returns: The length (in bytes) of the encoded result.

member.name: M:System.Buffers.Text.Base64Url.GetMaxDecodedLength(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns the maximum length (in bytes) of the result if you were to decode base 64 encoded text from a span of size .
member.param: The size of the input span.
member.returns: The maximum length (in bytes) of the decoded result.

member.name: M:System.Buffers.Text.Base64Url.IsValid(System.ReadOnlySpan{System.Byte},System.Int32@)
member.summary: Validates that the specified span of UTF-8 text is comprised of valid base-64 encoded data.
member.param: A span of UTF-8 text to validate.
If the method returns , the number of decoded bytes that will result from decoding the input UTF-8 text.
member.returns: if contains a valid, decodable sequence of base-64 encoded data; otherwise, .

member.name: M:System.Buffers.Text.Base64Url.IsValid(System.ReadOnlySpan{System.Byte})
member.summary: Validates that the specified span of UTF-8 text is comprised of valid base-64 encoded data.
member.param: A span of UTF-8 text to validate.
member.returns: if contains a valid, decodable sequence of base-64 encoded data; otherwise, .

member.name: M:System.Buffers.Text.Base64Url.IsValid(System.ReadOnlySpan{System.Char},System.Int32@)
member.summary: Validates that the specified span of text is comprised of valid base-64 encoded data.
member.param: A span of text to validate.
If the method returns , the number of decoded bytes that will result from decoding the input text.
member.returns: if contains a valid, decodable sequence of base-64 encoded data; otherwise, .

member.name: M:System.Buffers.Text.Base64Url.IsValid(System.ReadOnlySpan{System.Char})
member.summary: Validates that the specified span of text is comprised of valid base-64 encoded data.
member.param: A span of text to validate.
member.returns: if contains a valid, decodable sequence of base-64 encoded data; otherwise, .

member.name: M:System.Buffers.Text.Base64Url.TryDecodeFromChars(System.ReadOnlySpan{System.Char},System.Span{System.Byte},System.Int32@)
member.summary: Decodes the span of Unicode ASCII chars represented as Base64Url into binary data.
member.param: The input span which contains ASCII chars in Base64Url that needs to be decoded.
The output span which contains the result of the operation, i.e. the decoded binary data.

When this method returns, contains the number of bytes written into the output span. This can be used to slice the output for subsequent calls, if necessary. This parameter is treated as uninitialized.

exception.para: more than two padding characters, or a non white space character among the padding characters.

member.returns: if bytes decoded successfully; if is too small.

member.name: M:System.Buffers.Text.Base64Url.TryDecodeFromUtf8(System.ReadOnlySpan{System.Byte},System.Span{System.Byte},System.Int32@)
member.summary: Decodes the span of UTF-8 encoded text represented as Base64Url into binary data.
member.param: The input span which contains UTF-8 encoded text in Base64Url that needs to be decoded.
The output span which contains the result of the operation, i.e. the decoded binary data.

When this method returns, contains the number of bytes written into the output span. This can be used to slice the output for subsequent calls, if necessary. This parameter is treated as uninitialized.

exception.para: more than two padding characters, or a non white space character among the padding characters.

member.returns: if bytes decoded successfully; if is too small.

member.name: M:System.Buffers.Text.Base64Url.TryEncodeToChars(System.ReadOnlySpan{System.Byte},System.Span{System.Char},System.Int32@)
member.summary: Encodes the span of binary data into Unicode ASCII chars represented as Base64Url.
member.param: The input span which contains binary data that needs to be encoded.
The output span which contains the result of the operation, i.e. the ASCII chars in Base64Url.

When this method returns, contains the number of chars written into the output span. This can be used to slice the output for subsequent calls, if necessary. This parameter is treated as uninitialized.
member.returns: if chars encoded successfully; if is too small.

member.name: M:System.Buffers.Text.Base64Url.TryEncodeToUtf8(System.ReadOnlySpan{System.Byte},System.Span{System.Byte},System.Int32@)
member.summary: Encodes the span of binary data into UTF-8 encoded chars represented as Base64Url.
member.param: The input span which contains binary data that needs to be encoded.
The output span which contains the result of the operation, i.e. the UTF-8 encoded text in Base64Url.

When this method returns, contains the number of chars written into the output span. This can be used to slice the output for subsequent calls, if necessary. This parameter is treated as uninitialized.
member.returns: if bytes encoded successfully; if is too small.

member.name: M:System.Buffers.Text.Base64Url.TryEncodeToUtf8InPlace(System.Span{System.Byte},System.Int32,System.Int32@)

summary.para: Encodes the span of binary data (in-place) into UTF-8 encoded text represented as base 64.
The encoded text output is larger than the binary data contained in the input (the operation inflates the data).

param.name: buffer
param.para: The input span which contains binary data that needs to be encoded.
It needs to be large enough to fit the result of the operation.

param.name: dataLength
param.para: The amount of binary data contained within the buffer that needs to be encoded
(and needs to be smaller than the buffer length).

member.param: When this method returns, contains the number of bytes written into the buffer. This parameter is treated as uninitialized.
member.returns: if bytes encoded successfully; if is too small to fit the result.
